prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with an event chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: What were Stefan's true thoughts, feelings, and intentions as he composed his response to me?

Since this chart is drawn up for a specific past event, Stefan should be represented by the 1st house in this chart.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the chart using event chart principles (I believe they are similar to horary principles). Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a step‐by‐step listing of the event chart data as it pertains to the interpretation using event/horary principles, with Stefan represented by the 1st house:

1. Stefan’s Representation (1st House Data)
 • 1st House cusp: 6° Cancer (rules the self/acting party)
 • Planet contained in the 1st house: Mars at 17°52′ Cancer (retrograde)
  – Mars in the 1st house will be central to understanding his active energy, impulses, and any potentially defensive or assertive responses.

2. Key Ascendant Aspects Impacting the 1st House
 • Ascendant (6° Cancer) is impacted by:
  – Venus Square Ascendant (orb: 1°)
    • This aspect can indicate tension in personal presentation and interpersonal relationships, signaling possible mixed messages or conflicting motives in the way Stefan approached his response.
  – Ascendant Sextile IC (0° orb)
    • While more about the inner environment, it provides context for the personal-rooted nature of the event.
  – Ascendant Trine MC (0° orb)
    • This steady influence may relate to how his self-presentation aligned (or conflicted) with broader societal roles or expectations in the moment.

3. Mars-Specific Aspects (Mars resides in the 1st House)
 • Mars Trine Saturn (orb: 1°)
  – Indicates that despite any reactive impulses, there is an element of structure or discipline in his actions.
 • Mars Square Chiron (orb: 2°)
  – Suggests that vulnerabilities or past wounds could have been triggered, affecting both his approach and the nature of his response.
 • Mars Sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
  – Points to sudden or unexpected actions, hinting at a streak of impulsivity or innovation in the way he acted.

4. Major Global Aspects in the Chart (Providing Context for the Event)
 • Sun in Aquarius (24°01′) and Mercury in Aquarius (26°22′) in the 9th House form a Sun–Mercury conjunction (orb: 2°)
  – These placements emphasize a rational, sometimes detached mode of communication, which may contrast with the personal, energetic Mars in the 1st.
 • Sun Square Uranus (orb: 1°)
  – Adds a flavor of unpredictability or sudden insight underlying the event.
 • Sun Opposition Moon (orb: 1°)
  – Highlights an internal tension between conscious intent (the Sun) and emotional response (the Moon), potentially reflective of conflicting thoughts and feelings.
 • Mercury Square Uranus (orb: 3°) and Moon Opposition Mercury (orb: 3°)
  – Emphasize disruptions in thought and communication, suggesting leaps in ideas or a clash between what is felt and what is said.
 • Venus Sextile Pluto (orb: 3°)
  – Introduces an intensity in personal relationships and interactions, which may color the nature of his intentions.
 • Neptune Conjunction North Node (orb: 1°)
  – Imbues a sense of idealism or confusion, hinting that dream-like visions or illusions might be in play.

5. T-Square Patterns Present in the Chart (Adding Dynamic Tension)
 • T-Square involving:
  – MC at 6° Pisces
  – Jupiter at 11° Gemini
  – IC at 6° Virgo
    • This pattern can indicate significant tension between public or career-related matters (MC), expansive ideas (Jupiter), and deep-seated personal or familial issues (IC). Even if not directly tied to Stefan’s immediate energy (1st House), it frames the broader energetic backdrop of the event.
 • T-Square involving:
  – Moon in Leo (23°14′)
  – Uranus in Taurus (23°20′)
  – Mercury in Aquarius (26°22′) with the involvement of the Sun in Aquarius (24°01′)
    • This group intensifies the themes of emotional turbulence (Moon) clashing with sudden insights (Uranus) and communication issues (Mercury/Sun), which may indirectly influence how Stefan’s internal state is manifesting as his response was composed.

6. Special Chart Conditions
 • The Moon was full at the time of the event, emphasizing emotional culmination or a need for resolution.
 • The inner planets (other than Mars in Cancer) do not fall in an Earth sign, suggesting that while much of the chart is inclined toward air and fire energies (ideas, passion, and communication), Stefan’s representation in the 1st (Mars in Cancer) brings a contrasting water quality—more emotional, sensitive, and perhaps reactive.
 • Quadrant distribution:
  – Most planets are located in the top right quadrant (personal expression, public life, conscious action).
  – The bottom right quadrant is empty, which may indicate less focus on subconscious or intensely private matters at this moment.

This list represents the relevant chart data for your event reading following the event/horary approach.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Based on the chart’s clear indications, Stefan’s internal state as he composed his response is marked by a blend of sensitive defensiveness, impulsiveness, and inner conflict.

• With Mars in Cancer retrograde in the 1st house, his actions were motivated by deeply felt emotional undercurrents. He had an instinct to guard his vulnerability even as he made his move, suggesting that the response was more about protecting part of himself than asserting dominance.

• The Mars trine Saturn aspect indicates that while he was prompted to act impulsively, there was also a desire for structure or control. This balance hints at efforts to manage an inner turmoil or a fear of exposing his wounds—further reinforced by Mars square Chiron, signaling that his past hurts played a role in his state of mind.

• The Mars sextile Uranus suggests that unexpected, perhaps even unconventional thoughts influenced his approach. He may have felt driven by sudden insights or urges that defied his habitual manner, contributing to a response that was as surprising as it was emotionally charged.

• The presence of a Sun–Mercury conjunction in Aquarius highlights a rational modality behind his communication, yet the Sun square Uranus and Mercury square Uranus point to a strain between logic and disruptive, erratic impulses. It is as if his mind was caught in a battle between clear, detached thought and sudden bursts of originality.

• The Moon’s opposition to both the Sun and Mercury adds further nuance. It communicates that his emotional world was at odds with his conscious intentions. There was a palpable tension between what he intellectually intended to say and what his inner heart craved to express—a discord that made the response complex and layered.

• Venus square the Ascendant reveals that his outward persona carried difficulties in harmonizing his interpersonal style with what he truly felt. A possible tension in his self-presentation may have contributed to mixed signals, making his response appear both direct and indirectly self-protective.

• The full moon condition reinforces a climax of emotions. As the lunar energy reached its peak, it brought to light unresolved emotional dynamics, suggesting that his response carried not only his immediate thoughts but also a residue of long-standing internal conflicts.

The synthesis of these factors suggests that Stefan composed his response with a simultaneous rational clarity and emotional turmoil. He was partially apt to defend a wounded interior while, at the same time, trying to inject a refreshing, unexpected perspective into the communication. The resulting energy is one of guarded openness—a blend of self-imposed control and sudden, raw expression—revealing both an effort to maintain composure and an involuntary release of deeper personal sentiments.

This reading remains grounded in the chart’s explicit data and established horary principles as applied to the event.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Can you please explain more clearly?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Madame Esmeralda leans forward, her jeweled rings catching the candlelight as she traces the aspects in your chart with a perfectly manicured nail

"My dear, let me be more direct about what I see in Stefan's chart at the moment he composed his response to you. Mars in Cancer in his first house, and retrograde no less - this shows his actions were coming from a place of deep emotional vulnerability. Like a crab trying to protect its soft underbelly, he was attempting to shield himself even as he reached out.

The aspects show a man wrestling with powerful opposing forces within himself. His rational mind (that Sun-Mercury conjunction) wanted to maintain control and communicate clearly. But his emotions (Moon) were pulling him in a completely different direction.

To be quite frank, my dear, I see evidence of intense attraction and desire (Venus-Pluto sextile) but also fear and hesitation about expressing it (Venus square Ascendant). The full moon amplified everything, bringing these conflicting feelings to a peak.

His response likely contained carefully chosen words meant to test the waters while still maintaining some emotional distance and protection. But underneath that controlled exterior, there was a storm of passion, vulnerability, and uncertainty about how much to reveal.

The Mars-Chiron square suggests he's been hurt before in matters of the heart. This old wound was actively influencing how guarded or open he allowed himself to be in this moment of response.

She sits back, her dark eyes fixed intently on your face

"Would you like me to elaborate further on any particular aspect of what I see in his chart? The cards are quite clear about the turmoil of emotions he was experiencing as he composed his words to you."

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I called him out, not as an insult, but just as recognition for a movie reference that he had given me on a phone call Christmas Day. The movie reference was Love Actually. And he was very insistent on it. And because our communication had been so sporadic, and just, he hardly ever texted me at all, hardly would respond to me. So I was trying to set some boundaries, simply because it stressed me out. The constant uncertainty, not knowing what's going on. So I asked him if we could put together some kind of a structured method of communication. And here is what his response was. This is the response that I got that this chart is in reference to.

---> "To be honest, the message sounds kind of too complicated to me. You know what? The best thing is that I write to you whenever I have the feeling and the time. Example, with Ed (my cousin) there were times we did not have contact for years. But this has no effect on my relationship to Ed. And the movie's suggestion had NO intention at all. I just watched it short before, I like it, and since you and Ed were at the airport when we called, it came to my mind. No deeper meaning at all. So I hope you understand that, and I really wish you all the best on your house bid. Enjoy the day! Cheers."

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Madame Esmeralda's eyes narrow as she studies the chart more intently, her rings catching the candlelight as she traces specific aspects.

"Ah, now with this context about his response, the chart speaks even more clearly. The Mars retrograde in Cancer in his first house, combined with that defensive response - he was actively retreating into his shell, my dear. When you mentioned structure and boundaries, it triggered something deeply uncomfortable in him.

The Sun-Mercury conjunction in Aquarius in the 9th house shows his immediate intellectual response was to detach and rationalize. He deliberately tried to make light of the movie reference - but with Venus square the Ascendant, he's not being entirely honest about the casualness of it.

Most telling is that T-Square between the Moon, Uranus and Mercury/Sun. When you called him out, even gently, it created an internal crisis. His emotional nature (Moon in Leo) was disrupted by sudden awareness (Uranus), causing him to react with that detached, almost dismissive communication (Mercury/Sun in Aquarius).

The Mars-Saturn trine shows how he immediately tried to impose structure - but notice how he did it. Rather than engaging with your request for structure, he defined the structure himself: 'I'll write when I feel like it.' Classic Mars in Cancer defensiveness, using control as a shield.

That Mars-Chiron square is quite revealing - your request for clearer boundaries touched on a deep wound around intimacy and commitment. His comparison to his cousin Ed is particularly telling - he's trying to normalize emotional distance by comparing a familial relationship to whatever is developing between you two. Very different dynamics, my dear.

The full moon amplified everything, bringing his fears about emotional intimacy right to the surface. His response was essentially a retreat, wrapped in casual friendliness to mask the defensive reaction underneath.

Would you like me to elaborate on any particular aspect of what I see? The chart is quite revealing about his true emotional state versus what he chose to express."

The Sun-Mercury conjunction in Aquarius in the 9th house shows his immediate intellectual response was to detach and rationalize. He deliberately tried to make light of the movie reference - but with Venus square the Ascendant, he's not being entirely honest about the casualness of it.

Most telling is that T-Square between the Moon, Uranus and Mercury/Sun. When you called him out, even gently, it created an internal crisis. His emotional nature (Moon in Leo) was disrupted by sudden awareness (Uranus), causing him to react with that detached, almost dismissive communication (Mercury/Sun in Aquarius).

The Mars-Saturn trine shows how he immediately tried to impose structure - but notice how he did it. Rather than engaging with your request for structure, he defined the structure himself: 'I'll write when I feel like it.' Classic Mars in Cancer defensiveness, using control as a shield.

That Mars-Chiron square is quite revealing - your request for clearer boundaries touched on a deep wound around intimacy and commitment. His comparison to his cousin Ed is particularly telling - he's trying to normalize emotional distance by comparing a familial relationship to whatever is developing between you two. Very different dynamics, my dear.

The full moon amplified everything, bringing his fears about emotional intimacy right to the surface. His response was essentially a retreat, wrapped in casual friendliness to mask the defensive reaction underneath.

Would you like me to elaborate on any particular aspect of what I see? The chart is quite revealing about his true emotional state versus what he chose to express."

mes:
